meanings.definition: A woman who administers the estate of a deceased person.
meanings.sent1: The administratrix carefully managed the distribution of the inheritance.
meanings.sent2: The administratrix oversaw the legal process of dividing the assets.
meanings.sent3: The administratrix joked that she had become the 'queen of paperwork' after handling so many documents.
meanings.sent4: She was like an administratrix of memories, sorting through the belongings of the departed.
meanings.sent5: The administratrix's role was crucial in ensuring the will was executed correctly.

meanings.sent1: The school administratrix organized the student activities efficiently.
meanings.sent2: As an administratrix, she was responsible for managing the office operations.
meanings.sent3: The administratrix playfully referred to herself as the 'boss lady' of the workplace.
meanings.sent4: She ruled the office like an administratrix, making sure everything ran smoothly.
meanings.sent5: The administratrix's leadership skills were evident in the way she handled daily tasks.
